availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Nethercutt (Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Lee County, Virginia, native. Son of George Nethercutt and Rebecca Nethercutt. Married to Elizabeth Vanbibber Nethercutt. Father of Rebecca S. Nethercutt and Laura Caroline Nethercutt. Farmer in Carter County in 1850. Farmer in Carter County in 1860. Served in the 22nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a second lieutenant from January 18, 1862 to July 31, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 214A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 219.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 122.
